channel.title: Old on Keratoconus
channel.description: Recent content in Old on Keratoconus

item.title: Keratoconus what to do
item.description: The purpose of this article is to generate awareness of the phenomenon of ophthalmic degenerative diseases like keratoconus, and the importance of discovering how we use our eyes, and what we can do apart from getting lenses or other treatments to try to improve our condition.

item.title: keratoconus overview
item.description: Keratoconus overview Keratoconus from Greek: kerato (horn, cornea), and konos cone.

item.title: Contact Lenses for Keratoconus
item.description: Contact lenses for keratoconus There are “basically” three types of lenses, corneal lenses like the Rose K lenses; scleral lenses like the Digiform K lens, and Hybrid lenses like the Synergeyes lens.

item.description: Keratoconus types of cones Nipple cone - small and centrally located about 5mm in size.

item.title: Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy
item.description: Hyperbaric Oxygen therapy Hyperbaric oxygen therapy is the use of oxygen in a controlled high-pressure chamber, this is commonly used when divers have to get out fast of deep waters and experience problems; the blood in their bodies start to produce nitrogen bubbles much like a soda can that is opened after shaken, this can be dangerous.

item.title: Ayurveda remedies
item.description: Keratoconus treatment in Ayurveda The long history of Ayurveda remedies spanning thousands of years is basically and more elegantly explained as “getting along with nature and its rhythms”.

item.title: Do you have keratoconus?
item.description: Do you have keratoconus? The first time you realize you have visual problems is at school, you just can’t see clearly from behind the classroom, so you have to sit closer to the blackboard.

item.title: Causes of keratoconus
item.description: Causes of Keratoconus First, there may be many causes of keratoconus that are not known to us.
